sections.Introduction: Hanle is a village far east in the Ladakh region of India.
sections.Understand: Hanle is known as the "Dark Sky Reserve" of India and one of the most-visited sites of astronomy. The clear sky and zero light pollution in Hanle provide a crystal-clear view of the universe, thus making it a good destination for astronomy in India.
